questions.question: What does HTTPS stand for?
What is the primary goal of phishing attacks?
Which of the following is NOT an encryption algorithm?
What is a Zero-Day vulnerability?
options: A vulnerability that has been fixed immediately
A vulnerability that is unknown to the vendor
A vulnerability that only affects outdated systems
A vulnerability used by antivirus software

questions.question: Which attack involves tricking a user into clicking a malicious link?
What is the strongest password format?
options: A complex mix of letters, numbers, and symbols

questions.question: Which type of malware disguises itself as legitimate software?
What is the purpose of a firewall?
options: To block unauthorized access to a network
To remove viruses from a computer

questions.question: Which cybersecurity principle ensures that only authorized users can access data?
Which of these is an example of a Denial-of-Service (DoS) attack?
options: Sending a flood of traffic to a website to make it unavailable

questions.question: What is social engineering in cybersecurity?
options: Manipulating people into revealing confidential information
A method to encrypt user passwords

questions.question: Which cybersecurity framework is widely used for assessing security risks?
What is a brute force attack?
options: An attack that modifies database queries
An attack that encrypts data until a ransom is paid
An attack that tries all possible password combinations
An attack that redirects users to malicious websites

questions.question: What is the role of an Intrusion Detection System (IDS)?
options: To detect and alert about suspicious network activity

questions.question: Which of the following is a common method used to secure email communication?
Which protocol is used to securely transfer files over the internet?
What is the main purpose of a VPN in cybersecurity?
options: To encrypt and anonymize internet traffic

questions.question: Which OS feature helps prevent unauthorized applications from modifying system files?
What type of cyber attack involves overwhelming a system with excessive traffic?
Which of the following is a secure replacement for Telnet?
What does ARP stand for in networking?
Which command can be used to list open network connections in Linux?
What is the function of a DMZ (Demilitarized Zone) in network security?
options: To isolate public-facing services from the internal network
To act as a physical security barrier
To provide backup power to servers

questions.question: Which type of malware records a user's keystrokes?
Which operating system permission model ensures that a process cannot access resources it has not been granted?
What is the primary role of IDS (Intrusion Detection System)?
options: To detect and alert on suspicious activity
To remove malware from infected systems

questions.question: Which cybersecurity attack targets a web application's database through malicious queries?
Which network topology is most resilient to failure?
What is the main purpose of two-factor authentication (2FA)?
options: To replace the need for passwords
To add an extra layer of security beyond passwords
To automatically log users out after a session

questions.question: Which Linux command is used to change file permissions?
